intro: Microrrhinum minus, commonly known as the lesser centaury, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescence and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is found in Mediterranean regions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
